skill.name: mcp-builder
skill.description: Guide for creating high-quality MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers that enable LLMs to interact with external services through well-designed tools. Use when building MCP servers to integrate external APIs or services, whether in Python (FastMCP) or Node/TypeScript (MCP SDK).
skill.summary: Guide for creating high-quality MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers that enable LLMs to interact wi...

security_audit.summary: This is an official Anthropic skill, so a minimal audit is applied. No security findings were identified in the scanned files.

content.user_title: Build MCP servers with proven workflows
content.value_statement: Struggle to turn an API into a reliable MCP server with clear tools and schemas. This guide and scripts provide design steps, language patterns, and an evaluation harness to validate tool quality.
actual_capabilities: Provides a phased workflow for MCP server research, implementation, review, and evaluation.
Includes a TypeScript MCP SDK guide with project structure and Zod schema patterns.
Includes a Python FastMCP guide with Pydantic models and tool registration examples.
Supplies an evaluation harness that runs XML QA tasks through Claude with MCP tools.
Supports stdio, SSE, and streamable HTTP connections in evaluation utilities.
limitations: Does not ship a complete MCP server implementation for a specific API.
Evaluation harness requires Anthropic API access and valid credentials.
Python scripts depend on the anthropic and mcp packages.
External documentation links must be fetched separately.

use_cases.title: Plan a new MCP server
use_cases.description: Turn an API into clear tools with naming, schemas, and pagination guidance.

use_cases.title: Choose transport and stack
use_cases.description: Decide between stdio, SSE, and streamable HTTP with language specific patterns.

use_cases.title: Evaluate tool quality
use_cases.description: Run XML based evaluation tasks and review accuracy and tool feedback.

prompt_templates.title: Start a server plan
prompt_templates.scenario: You have an API and need an MCP plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a step by step plan to build an MCP server for the Example API. Include tool naming, schemas, and pagination choices.

prompt_templates.title: Design tool list
prompt_templates.scenario: You need tools for common API tasks
prompt_templates.prompt: List the MCP tools you would implement for the Example API, with clear names and short descriptions.

prompt_templates.title: Create eval questions
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft 10 evaluation questions for an MCP server that integrates the Example API. Each question must be read only and verifiable.

prompt_templates.title: Run eval harness
prompt_templates.scenario: You want to run XML evaluations
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to run the evaluation script against a stdio MCP server, including required arguments and output options.

output_examples.input: Summarize how to evaluate my MCP server
output: Prepare an evaluation XML file with ten read only questions and answers
Connect to the server using stdio, SSE, or HTTP
Run the evaluation script and review accuracy and tool feedback
Save the report to a file for later comparison

best_practices: Use clear tool names with action verbs and consistent prefixes
Return structured content with schemas to help clients parse results
Include evaluation tasks that require multiple tool calls
anti_patterns: Creating tools with vague names that hide intent
Returning unstructured blobs without pagination or filters
Skipping evaluation and relying on manual testing only

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance is platform agnostic, and the evaluation script uses Claude via the Anthropic SDK.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and scripts, but no finished MCP server for a specific service.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my existing API?
faq.answer: Use the tool design and schema sections, then implement endpoints in the language guide.

faq.question: Does the evaluation script store my data?
faq.answer: No local storage is added by default. Data is sent to the model API you configure.

faq.question: What should I do if evaluation fails to connect?
faq.answer: Check transport settings, command or URL, and required headers or environment variables.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic API wrappers?
faq.answer: It focuses on MCP tool design, schemas, and evaluation for agent effectiveness.
